column2: Listen y\xc2\x92know what sir? For the last time, I don\xc2\x92t care what\nthe computer says, we did not take a bag of Mashuga nuts from the mini-bar and we did not\nwatch Dr. Do-Me-A-Little!'
(entering) Hey!'
Oh! Joey uh, were you in our room last night?'
No. (Phoebe grabs the receipt and shows it to Joey who gets mad.) I was\ntold the name of the movie would not appear on the bill!'
(to the front desk clerk) Hi! We\xc2\x92re checking out of the bridal\nsuite.'
(depressed) That\xc2\x92s right. I\xc2\x92m no longer a bride. I\xc2\x92ll\nnever be a bride again. Now, I\xc2\x92m just someone\xc2\x92s wife!'
And I\xc2\x92m the happiest guy in the world! (Monica goes and sits down\nin a huff.) Oh honey, come on don\xc2\x92t be upset. We still have so much to look forward\nto!'
Oh yeah, right. (Rolls her eyes.)'
We got the honeymoon.'
That\xc2\x92s not \xc2\x91til Thursday.'
The wedding pictures?'
They won\xc2\x92t be ready for weeks.'
Not the disposable cameras from the tables.'
That\xc2\x92s true! (Happily) I knew I married you for a reason!'
I\xc2\x92ll tell you what, I will go get them developed and you can go\nhome.'
Okay.'
What? What did you take a picture of?'
Nothing! It was something.'
Okay Ross has the cameras, has he checked out yet?'
Are you joking? Check out is not \xc2\x91til noon and he has a good\n(checks her watch) eleven minutes left.'
Oh.'
Ross has never checked out of a room a minute before he had to.'
Yeah, one time, when we were dating, uh we got a late checkout, he got\nso excited it was the best sex we ever had. Until y\xc2\x92know, he screamed out Radisson\nat the end.'
Okay, well I\xc2\x92m gonna get Ross, get the cameras, and get them\ndeveloped. (Joey laughs again.) 32 Joe. You\xc2\x92re 32! (Exits)'
(To Monica) Here\xc2\x92s a copy of your bill.'
Oh thanks. (Reading the bill) Champagne, strawberries\xc2\x85Oh my God! I\ncan\xc2\x92t believe Chandler ordered porn on our wedding night!'
Yeah, that\xc2\x92s sad. Mashuga nut?'
Hi.'
Hey. (He sees that Ross is packing all of the hotel toiletries) Soaps?\nShampoos? Are you really taking all this stuff?'
Why not? It\xc2\x92s built into the price of the room.'
Yeah but you don\xc2\x92t need\xc2\x97(Picks up something)\xc2\x97What is\nthis?'
Thread!'
Score! Where are the disposable cameras?'
What disposable cameras?'
The cameras? Remember last night I told you to take them?'
No you didn\xc2\x92t.'
Yes! Remember? Right before we cut the cake, I went up to you and I\nsaid\xc2\x85'

Oh-oh yeah, you-you came up to me and asked if I could do you a favor, and
my Uncle Murray came up to you and handed you a check. And then you said, "Why do
they call it a check? Why not a Yugoslavian?" (Chandler laughs.) Yeah, then you did
that.'
So you don\xc2\x92t have the cameras?!'
No. Sorry man.'
So? What? What? They\xc2\x92re gone! Monica\xc2\x92s gonna freak!'
Well, I\xc2\x92m sure they\xc2\x92re still somewhere here in the hotel.\nI\xc2\x92ll-I\xc2\x92ll help you look for them.'
Great.'
In-in three minutes.'
Hey!'
Hey!'
Are you gonna open the presents without Chandler?'

No! (Pause) But, they\xc2\x92re callin\xc2\x92 out to me! I mean this little\nguy (Holds up a small one) even crawled up into my lap. Oh come on, Chandler wouldn\xc2\x92t\nmind if I opened just one present! What do you think it is?'
A little mirror that when you look into it you see yourself as an old\nwoman.'
A tiny salt shaker!!!'
Ohhh! My God! For tiny salt!'
Oh wow! Okay. Well that was fun.'
Oh yeah.'
Good. Okay, I\xc2\x92m just gonna wait for Chandler to open the rest of\nthem.'
Okay.'
Whew. Although y\xc2\x92know, this is part of a salt and pepper set. I\nmean\xc2\x85 I guess y\xc2\x92know it may just count as a half a present. What do you think?'
Well I guess it\xc2\x92s okay to open one more if it\xc2\x92s part of a set.\nY\xc2\x92know, it\xc2\x92s probably this one. (Grabs another small one.)'
Or this one! (She grabs and starts to open the biggest present.)'
(entering) Hi.'
Hey, how are you feelin\xc2\x92? Any morning sickness?'
Shh-shh-shh! The guys don\xc2\x92t know yet do they?'
No! Joey and Ross don\xc2\x92t know anything and Chandler still thinks\nthat Phoebe\xc2\x92s pregnant.'

Yeah that\xc2\x92s right Chandler does still think I\xc2\x92m pregnant. He\nhasn\xc2\x92t asked me how I\xc2\x92m feeling or offered to carry my bags. Boy, I feel bad for\nthe woman who ends up with him. (Monica looks at her.) After you of course.'
Don\xc2\x92t worry I promise that you will only have to be pregnant for a\nfew more hours, \xc2\x91cause I\xc2\x92m going to tell the father today.'
Ooh, is it someone in this building? Is it that tall guy from the first\nfloor?'
Ew! No!'
What?! I think he\xc2\x92s cute.'
Well then you have his baby.'
Believe me I\xc2\x92m trying.'
Wow. Y\xc2\x92know it is so weird. I mean, you\xc2\x92re gonna tell this guy\ntoday and he has no idea what\xc2\x92s gonna happen.'
Yeah. You\xc2\x92re just gonna knock on his door and change his life\nforever. You\xc2\x92re like Ed McMahon except without the big check, or the raw sexual\nmagnetism.'
Yeah. Uh-huh, I guess it is pretty big news.'

Pretty big? It\xc2\x92s huge! God, this guy doesn\xc2\x92t have a clue!\nHe\xc2\x92s just walking down the street thinking, \xc2\x91I had sex with Rachel Green. I\nrock!\xc2\x92 then bam! He\xc2\x92s a father and everything\xc2\x92s different.'
Well it\xc2\x92s only different if he wants it to be. I mean, I\xc2\x92m not\ngonna ask him for anything.'
Okay. Then he still has this huge decision to make. Now he\xc2\x92s\nwalking around thinking, \xc2\x91Do I want to be a dad?\xc2\x92 and then bam!'
What was that bam?'
I don\xc2\x92t. He got\xc2\x85he-he-he-he\xc2\x92s hit by a bus.'
(entering) Hey!'
Hey Joey, what would you do if someone that you slept with told you that\nshe was pregnant?'
(warily) Who called here? Did she sound blond? Huh? Did-did-did she have\nan accent? I gotta make a call! (Starts to leave) I shoulda never walked into that\nSunglass Hut!'
Oh Joey! Joey! No, it\xc2\x92s not you! You didn\xc2\x92t get anybody\npregnant!'
Oh. Why would you scare me like that? What the hell is going on? (Pause.)\nIs somebody pregnant?'
Oh yeah. That\xc2\x92s me.'
Oh my God Pheebs! You\xc2\x92re gonna have a baby?'
Yes. Yes I am. Oh my God, I\xc2\x92m gonna have a baby! (Joey and Phoebe\nhug.)'
Whoa, wait a minute. Who\xc2\x92s the father?'
You don\xc2\x92t know him. It\xc2\x92s not important. He wants nothing to do\nwith me or the baby. (She sits down like she\xc2\x92s pregnant.)'
Well who is this guy?! Huh? Who is he? \xc2\x91Cause I will track him down\nand kick his ass!'
David Lynn.'
David Lynn! David Lynn! David Lynn!! (Exits)'
Who\xc2\x92s David Lynn?'
Oh some guy from my gym. A little annoying.'
Chandler?'
Hey! Did you find the cameras?'
No. Did you?'
Yes! And that\xc2\x92s why I\xc2\x92m under the table. Celebrating.'
Well I checked in the uh, lost and found, I talked to the manager,\nno-one\xc2\x92s turned them.'
Well this is great. Y\xc2\x92know, those cameras were the only thing\nthat was gonna cheer Monica up today, she\xc2\x92s really depressed.'
Now you guys just got married, why is she so depressed?'
All my energy is going into not asking that question. I can\xc2\x92t\nbelieve I screwed this up!'
I\xc2\x92m sorry man. (Formally dressed people start to enter.) Here\xc2\x92s\na thought. This is the same ballroom. There\xc2\x92s a band. There\xc2\x92s gonna be plenty of\ndressed up people.'
Are you suggesting we dance our troubles away?'

No-no-no, I\xc2\x92m saying we-we buy more of this (disposable cameras) at\nthe gift shop, throw our tuxes back on, and take a few pictures. All we have to do is make\nsure not to get anybody else\xc2\x92s faces.'
Are you serious?'
I\xc2\x92m just thinking about your new bride at home. Okay? Do-do you\nreally want to start your life together by letting her down?'
Marriage advice? Really?!'
I\xc2\x92m telling you, this looks exactly like your wedding! Aren\xc2\x92t\nthese the same flowers?'
I don\xc2\x92t know, Monica picked out the flowers.'
What about the chairs?'
She picked those out too.'
How about the place settings?'
That was her.'
What did you do?'
I was in charge of the cameras! Gift shop?'
Hmm. (They head off to the gift shop.)'
Hey! Ooh, did you do it yet?'
Not yet.'
Oh, well what are you doing here? Are you about to do it? (Gasps) Is it\nGunther?'
No! Phoebe, it\xc2\x92s not Gunther.'
Thank God, \xc2\x91cause that hair on a baby\xc2\x85'
Phoebe the father is not here okay? I haven\xc2\x92t told him yet and I\ndon\xc2\x92t think I can tell him at all now!'
Why not?'
I don\xc2\x92t know, let me think. I was walking down the street thinking,\n\xc2\x91I\xc2\x92m gonna tell the father today\xc2\x92 and then bam!'
Bus?'
No, you! Phoebe you freaked me out. You kept saying how huge this all\nis!'
Well-well but it is huge.'
I know, but I was just thinking about how huge this is for me. I\ndidn\xc2\x92t even go to how huge this was going to be for the father.'

You\xc2\x92re thinking about this way too much. Just tell him and get it\nover with. It\xc2\x92s like, it\xc2\x92s like ripping off this Band-Aid. (On her arm) Quick\nand painless, watch. (Rips it off.) Oh mother of\xc2\x85See?'
(entering) Ooh-ooh-ooh! Are we opening presents?'

No! No! I shouldn\xc2\x92t have even opened these! I mean I\xc2\x97Joey I am\nout of control!! Joey, you have to do me a favor. No matter what I say, no matter what I\ndo, please do not let me open another present! Okay?'
Okay.'
Give me one more.'
Okay. (Hands her one.)'
(entering) Hey.'
Oh good, uh you\xc2\x92re here. Uh Pheebs? Listen uh sit down. I-I got\nsomething I want to say. '
All right. (She sits down like she\xc2\x92s pregnant again.)'

Umm, now uh\xc2\x85 It\xc2\x92s a scary world out there, especially for a\nsingle mom. Y\xc2\x92know, now I always thought you and I had a special bond so\xc2\x85 (He\ngoes to one knee and pulls out a ring.) Phoebe Buffay, will you marry me?'
Oh my God! Joey!'
Hell yeah! I\xc2\x92ll marry you! (She grabs the ring and puts it on.)'
You can\xc2\x92t marry him!'
Hey lady, your day\xc2\x92s over! It\xc2\x92s my turn!'
Phoebe!'
Why?! Why can\xc2\x92t she marry me?!'
I can and I will! (Kisses him.)'
She\xc2\x92s not pregnant. It\xc2\x92s Rachel. Rachel\xc2\x92s the one\nwho\xc2\x92s pregnant.'
Oh my God.'
Hey!'
Phoebe I think he would notice if you didn\xc2\x92t have a baby in nine\nmonths!'
It\xc2\x92s Joey! (Joey turns and looks at her and she mouths \xc2\x91I love\nyou\xc2\x92 to him.)'
(smiles then stops) Now I can\xc2\x92t believe it! What? Rachel\xc2\x92s\npregnant? (The girls nod yes.) Who\xc2\x92s the father?'
We don\xc2\x92t know.'
Ohh\xc2\x85 I wonder if that dude.'
There\xc2\x92s a dude?'
Yeah.'
Who? Who is it?'
About a month ago this guy spent the night with Rachel, I didn\xc2\x92t see\nwho it was but\xc2\x85 (He walks out and closes the door.)'
Was that story over? '
The guy left this.'
(gasps) Oh my God! I know who the father is\xc2\x85 (She walks into Monica\nand Chandler\xc2\x92s.)'
People have got to finish their stories!'
(to another couple) Uh, excuse me? Could you take a picture of us?'
Oh! Of course. (Ross and Chandler pose and she takes the\npicture.)'
Uh, would you take one of us?'
Uhh\xc2\x85 Yeah sure. (Holds the camera up to his face.) Click!'
It didn\xc2\x92t click.'
I heard it. I heard it.'
But there was no flash.'
Why won\xc2\x92t you take our picture?'
Oh yeah. I\xc2\x92ll take, I\xc2\x92ll take your picture. (He takes the\npicture with his finger over the lens.)'
Uh, your finger was covering the lens.'
Who are you? Ansel Adams?! Get outta here!'
Look, I feel really bad about how I freaked you out before, so I called\nthe father and asked him to meet you here so you can tell him. Go!'
What? Hey wait a minute! Phoebe, how do you even know who the father is?'

I may play the fool at times, but I\xc2\x92m a little more than a pretty\nblond girl with an ass that won\xc2\x92t quit. (She takes the sweater out of her purse.) I\nbelieve this belongs to the father of your baby.'
Oh God\xc2\x85 Oh, he\xc2\x92s in there right now?'
Uh-huh. Now you can turn around or you can go in there and rip the\nBand-Aid off. What to you want to do?'
Uh, let\xc2\x92s rip!'
Really? Are you sure?'
Oh Phoebe!'
Okay, sorry. Yeah. (They go inside to confront the father.)'
Hey Rach.'
Why don\xc2\x92t you go up on stage. I\xc2\x92ll get a picture of you\ndoing the speech.'
Okay. Okay! '
Will the owner of a 1995 Buick LeSabre please see the front desk? Your car\nis about to be towed.'
(rushing up) That\xc2\x92s my car!'
A \xc2\x9295 LeSabre?!'
Yes!'
A green LeSabre?'
Yes!'
I\xc2\x92m sorry, I meant a blue LeSabre.'
Yes! Green-blue!'
Well go! Go move it! (He runs off.)'
Okay, you ready for the last picture?'
Yeah.'
Get ready to run. (Chandler walks over to the new bride.)\nCongratulations on your wedding. (He grabs her, kisses her, Ross takes the picture, and\nthey both run out.)'
So, what\xc2\x92s this about?'
Rachel has something that she wants to tell you and umm, I believe that\nthis is your red sweater.'
No. (Unzips his coat.) This is my red sweater.'
Oh no. Could I get anyone a coffee or\xc2\x85poison? No? Just for me?\nOkay. (Walks away.)'
What\xc2\x92s going on Rach?'
Nothing! Phoebe kinda made a mistake. But y\xc2\x92know you do wear that\nsweater a lot, are you involved in some kind of dare?'

Y\xc2\x92know, I\xc2\x92m actually glad Phoebe called. (He pulls out a stool\nand Rachel sits down.) I know we broke up because you thought I wasn\xc2\x92t mature enough,\nbut I\xc2\x92ve really grown up and think we should get back together.'
Oh, it\xc2\x92s just not the right time.'
It is the right time. (Takes her hand.)'
Okay.'
I\xc2\x92m ready for more.'
Tag\xc2\x85'
Come on Rach, let\xc2\x92s give it another try.'
I\xc2\x92m having a baby.'
Oh. (He drops her hand.)'
You can go.'
Thank you. (Gets up and hurries out.)'
(throwing up the last present) I don\xc2\x92t know how any of these got\nopened?!'
(entering) You opened them all?'
I know! I know! I am a terrible person! I mean, Chandler is never going\nto trust me with anything ever again!'
Oh hey! You got my parent\xc2\x92s gift! (Holds it up.)'
Yeah. What is that?'
Well, I don\xc2\x92t know. I think it does something to salami.'
Hey! How\xc2\x92d it go?'
Yeah. What-what did Tag say?'
Tag is not the father! And Joey knows now?'
I do Rach. I do, and I so happy for you. (They hug.)'
Oh wow, you didn\xc2\x92t even try to unhook my bra!'
So are you ever gonna tell whoever it is?'
No, I will. I\xc2\x92m just not up for it tonight.'
Hey Rach listen, no matter what this guy says I want you to know\nyou\xc2\x92re not gonna be alone in this.'
I\xc2\x92m not?'

Listen I uh\xc2\x85 (He takes her hand.) It\xc2\x92s a scary world out there
especially if you\xc2\x92re a single mom. Y\xc2\x92know, I always felt like you and I have
this-this special bond. Y\xc2\x92know? So, (gets down on one knee again) Rachel Green will
you marry me?'
What?'
What?!'
What?!!'
Pheebs, give me the ring back!'
No!!'
No! Joey, oh you\xc2\x92re so sweet. You\xc2\x92re so-so sweet, honey. But\nI\xc2\x92m not, I\xc2\x92m not looking for a husband.'
(heartbroken) I understand.'
Now, if you will excuse me I am going to go and lie down. (Exits.)'
I can\xc2\x92t say that didn\xc2\x92t hurt. But I\xc2\x92ll take you back Joey\nTribbiani.'
Uh yeah. Pheebs, listen about that. I only offered\xc2\x85'
Ooh! A Salami Buddy!'
There you go!'
We\xc2\x92re back!'
Great! We\xc2\x92re hangin\xc2\x92 in the kitchen! (She drags him into the\nkitchen and turns his back to the living room) Let\xc2\x92s stay in the kitchen!'
It\xc2\x92s picture time.'
Now you are going to love these.'

(showing her the pictures) Here\xc2\x92s a picture of Ross. (Shows\nanother one.) And that\xc2\x92s me. (Another one.) And that\xc2\x92s me and Ross.\n(Another one.) Oh-ho, that is a picture of our first kiss as a married couple.'
Wow! That is a great picture!'
Eh?'
Yeah! Oh and interesting because I found the cameras in one of our bags!\n(Throws them into his chest.)'
Huh, didn\xc2\x92t see that coming.'

Okay, so this isn\xc2\x92t a picture of our first, but it is a picture
of my first kiss with\xc2\x85with this lady. Which by the look on your face I\xc2\x92m sure
you\xc2\x92ll remember. So we don\xc2\x92t need\xc2\x97(Rips the picture)\xc2\x97There\xc2\x92s no
need to have this picture. How about I take the real pictures and get them developed right
now.'
That would be a good idea.'
Okay. (Sees the living room.) You opened all the presents without me?!\nI thought we were supposed to do that together!'
You kissed another woman!'
Call it even?!'
Okay! (They high-five and he walks out.)'
Well, I\xc2\x92m gonna go get these (the floral bouquet he walked in with)\nin some water.'
Wait you stole those from these people\xc2\x92s wedding?'

No-no, I took them from the hotel lobby. Yeah, they think they can charge\nme for some dirty movie and a bag of Mashuga nuts, they got another think coming. (Starts\nto leave.) Hey! My sweater! I\xc2\x92ve been looking for this for like a month!'
Oh my God!!'
(slow on the uptake) Oh my God!'
Hey! How you doing?'
Good! Good, long time no see.'
Yeah.'
Like your sweater.'
Oh hey, right back at ya.'
Oh, it\xc2\x92s crazy about Rachel huh?'
Yeah. She\xc2\x97Well, she\xc2\x92s one crazy lady?'
So whose is it?'
(shows Tag his sweater tag) Umm, I don\xc2\x92t some Italian guy. Come on,\nread your own label. See you later.'
Okay.'
He is so weird.'
